statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: American 75, Towson 64
article.story: TOWSON, Md. (AP) -- Jason Thomas had a career-high 26 points and grabbed 11 rebounds and American beat Towson 75-64 Wednesday night for its fourth consecutive victory. Thomas hit 8-of-9 shots from the field, connected on 5-of-5 3-pointers and converted all five of his free throws for the Eagles (4-2). Lawrence Hamm led the Tigers (2-6) with 20 points and nine rebounds. Winstonn Tubbs added 10 points for Towson, which has lost five straight games. Patrick Okpwae added a career-high 16 points for American, which improved to 21-4 all-time against Towson with its first road victory in three tries this season. Thomas had 11 first-half points, helping American to a 30-24 lead at halftime. Jonathan Pease's 3-pointer put Towson ahead 13-12 with 14:46 remaining in the first half, but the Eagles retaliated with an 11-1 run for a 23-14 lead. Okpwae had six points in the spurt, on a layup, a putback and a turnaround jumper. Okpwae opened the second half by converting an alley-OOP feed from Linas Lekavicius, Thomas drained a pair of 3-pointers and Andre Ingram's drive with 16:52 left put American up 42-32. Five of the Tigers' first six field goals in the second half were 3-pointers and Tubb's trey with 13:44 remaining got Towson within 47-41. But Okpwae's one-handed baseline sparked a 12-0 run, with a 3 by Ingram capping the spree and giving American a 59-41 lead.
